column4: let me explain it like this, i would like to use my cell phone as a live cd for a linux distro so that when im at a buddies comp i can use nix instead of windows./
If you can get this phone to work as a USB drive, sure, just use unetbootin.
FAT, FAT32 and ext2 should work for a LiveCD-like boot partition if you're using Unetbootin.
I suggest you replace that with Dropbox and forget about it like a bad nightmare
Well, I didn't like it back when I tried
the only thing i don't like about it is that I can specify folders to sync, i have to duplicate files or move the entire directory in windows to the sync folder.
can i play music from dropbox?
Well, a dropbox is just a folder anywhere you want. So yes
It's just synced to the net
checking it out now, no fee at all?
but do I have to cache the files on my phone or can i stream music directly from the dropbox servers?
You can as long as it's in your Public folder, then you can just feed the link to your phone lol
yeah I didn't think about that. i can just tell the media player to play from the url.
